Here are some useful links that I believe are of tremendous help for research assistants:

* [Development Impact Evaluation Unit's computational reproducibility](https://github.com/worldbank/dime-standards): a repository with information about coding and research standards at DIME.

* [ietoolkit](https://worldbank.github.io/ietoolkit/): Stata package for impact evaluation analysis

* [iefieldkit](https://dimewiki.worldbank.org/wiki/Iefieldkit): Stata package for primary data collection

* [Stata Visual Library](https://worldbank.github.io/stata-visual-library/): Reproducible code for graphs and maps in an easy-to-browse format

* [R Econ Visual Library](https://worldbank.github.io/r-econ-visual-library/): R code for data visualization in economics

* [Tidyverse style guide](https://style.tidyverse.org/)

* [Introduction to R for advanced Stata users](https://github.com/worldbank/dime-r-training)

* [RStudio Cheatsheets](https://rstudio.com/resources/cheatsheets/)

* [Development research in practice](https://worldbank.github.io/dime-data-handbook/)

* [Stata-Latex tables](https://github.com/worldbank/stata-tables)
